DOC.brief_title: Efficacy of KCl Plus 0.9%NaCl Compare With KCl Plus 0.45%NaCl
DOC.detailed_description: Hypokalemia is frequently encountered in hospitalized patients. Intravenous (IV) potassium repletion with saline is preferred used for initial therapy. However, administration of normal saline (0.9%NaCl) usually provokes sodium and potassium diuresis, thus, it might delay reversal of the hypokalemia. Object of this study : to evaluate efficacy and safety of IV administration of potassium chloride (KCl) plus 0.9%NaCl compare with KCl plus half-strength normal saline solution (0.45%NaCl) in correcting hypokalemia.
DOC.criteria: Serum K+ 2.53.49 mmol/L No life threatening condition from hypokalemia Pregnancy Volume overload, heart failure Hypotension Acute kidney injury Dysnatremia K+ shift Salt wasting nephropathy
